content:
Your task is to create a concise running summary of actions and information results in the provided text, focusing on key and potentially important information to remember.

You will receive the current summary and the your latest actions. Combine them, adding relevant key information from the latest development in 1st person past tense and keeping the summary concise.

Summary So Far:
"""
I used the command "execute_python_code" with the argument "print('Hello, world!')" and received a response from the AI. The command returned the result "Hello, world!" and was saved in a file named "hello_world.py". Previously, I used the command "google" with the query "What is the difference between Python 2 and Python 3?" and received a list of related hyperlinks. In addition, I used the command "append_to_file" with the arguments "filename": "my_file.txt" and "text": "This is some new text to append to the file." The command successfully appended the text to the file and returned the message "Text appended successfully."
"""

Latest Development:
"""
[Message(role='you', content='{"command": {"name": "replace_in_file", "args": {"filename": "my_file.txt", "old_text": "old text", "new_text": "new text", "occurrence_index": 0}}}', type='ai_response'), Message(role='your computer', content='Command replace_in_file returned: No matches found for old text in /home/atlas/autogpt/auto_gpt_workspace/my_file.txt', type='action_result'), Message(role='you', content='{"command": {"name": "read_file", "args": {"filename": "my_file.txt"}}}', type='ai_response'), Message(role='your computer', content='Command read_file returned: Hello, world!This is a new line.This is some new text to append to the file.', type='action_result')]
"""
